instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02016: What is 820-02016? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
This arrived with minor liquid damage in <TRANSISTOR>Q5240</TRANSISTOR> area and pin 1 of JP600 with no power.

After reflowing corrosion in <TRANSISTOR>Q5240</TRANSISTOR> area board was working again but after a few minutes screen went on and off a few times and now board cant get past 5v. Screen cable is burnt.

Diode mode on <SIGNAL>LPD_INT_AUX_C_N</SIGNAL> is 0. Does it sound like  50v from backlight killed the CPU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Do you have short to ground at  <SIGNAL>LPDP_INT_AUX_C_N</SIGNAL>, w/ and w/o LCD connected?
You may need to remove JP600, to discard it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Yes short to ground <SIGNAL>LPDP_INT_AUX_C_N</SIGNAL> w/ and w/o LCD.

can JP600 only cause 5V ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: If the short is on M1, you can expect any weird symptom...
